greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: inverse binomial transform of A059576
comment: The inverse binomial transform of the triangle A059576 is given by multiplying the triangle with A130595 from the left.
example: First few rows of the triangle =
maple: if k <= n and k >= 0 then
add((-1)^j*2^(n-j-1)*binomial(k, j)*binomial(n-j, k), j = 0 .. min(k, n-k))
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_ and  _Roger L. Bagula_, Mar 08 2009
